com.jidesoft.dialog
Class BannerPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  com.jidesoft.dialog.AbstractPage
                      com.jidesoft.dialog.BannerPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, Laziness, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class BannerPanel
extends AbstractPage

BannerPanel is a panel that can show title, subtitle and an icon with title on top, subtitle on the bottom and icon on the left. It can be placed on top of any dialog to show some help information or display a product logo.

See Also:
Serialized Form

BannerPanel

Method Detail

lazyInitialize

public void lazyInitialize()
Description copied from class: AbstractPage
This method must be implemented by any child class. However you should never call this method directly. Call initialize() if you want to force a call to this method.

Specified by:
lazyInitialize in interface Laziness
Specified by:
lazyInitialize in class AbstractPage

getBackgroundPaint

public java.awt.Paint getBackgroundPaint()
Gets the Paint used to paint the background of the BannerPanel.

Returns:
the Paint used to paint the background.

setBackgroundPaint

public void setBackgroundPaint(java.awt.Paint backgroundPaint)
Sets the Paint used to paint the background of the BannerPanel. User can set the paint to a gradient paint to make the BannerPanel looks attractive.

Parameters:
backgroundPaint -

setTitle

public void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
Sets the title.

Make sure call this method before lazyInitialize() is called. It lazyInitialized() has been called, after you are done with modifying, call lazyInitialize() again.

Parameters:
title - the new title.

public int getSubTitleIndent()
Gets the subtitle indent.

Returns:
the subtitle indent.

setSubTitleIndent

public void setSubTitleIndent(int subTitleIndent)
Sets the subtitle indent. Subtitle is always behind the title. The indent will decide how behind. It's in pixels.

Make sure call this method before lazyInitialize() is called. It lazyInitialized() has been called, after you are done with modifying, call lazyInitialize() again.

Parameters:
subTitleIndent - the new index.
